author: M K
text:
A double-barrel bridge load gun with 25 rounds and 10 single bullets were among the valuables that were stolen from the house of a Border Security Force (BSF) jawan at Ramanathapuram area in Chinna Thadagam near Thudiyalur on Sunday.

According to police, BSF Head Constable Thiruvasagam who has served in the force as a jawan for more than 20 years (and is now stationed at Gujarat) would be retiring in August 2016 and was planning to work as security officer in a bank after his retirement.

For this purpose, he bought the licensed gun at Kungan in Jammu and Kashmir on April 20, 2013. He had left his gun at home. His wife Jeyasri (35) and daughters Jivitha (10) and Aarthi (5) lived here. On Sunday morning, they went to their relative’s place at Annur. Ms. Jeyasri left the house key with her sister Saraswathi. Ms. Saraswathi went to Ms. Jeyasri’s house for some work and returned around 10.30 a.m. Around 11 a.m. a neighbour found the house open.

Thudiyalur police said that nine sovereigns of gold jewellery were also stolen along with the gun and bullets.
title: Double-barrel gun, bullets stolen
